English: The words of Amos, who was among the sheepbreeders of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
Bahnar: Nơ̆r Amôs bơngai wei triu oei tơ pơlei Thekoa; noh nơ̆r mă Kră Yang đei tơ'bôh tơblang ăn kơ sư gah lu bơngai Isơrael 'bar sơnăm adrol kơ teh tơdrŏ. Noh lăm chăl Usia pơm pơtao đe Juđa păng lăm chăl Jêrôbôam, kon drŏ-nglo Jêhôas, pơm pơtao đe Isơrael.

English: And he said: “The LORD roars from Zion, And utters His voice from Jerusalem; The pastures of the shepherds mourn, And the top of Carmel withers.”
Bahnar: Amôs khan: Kră Yang gô krao ôr đơ̆ng Siôn. Sư gô ôr pơret nơ̆r sư đơ̆ng Jêrusalem. Dôm lu 'nhĕt 'nhot bơngai wei triu kro jô păng tơ kơ̆l Kông Karmel 'long pơgê kư̆m jô kro mơ̆n.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they have threshed Gilead with implements of iron.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Đamas rai pơm yoch pơm yoch hloh kơ adrol, thoi ei na Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư. Yua kơ lu sư pơjuă dêh char Gileat thoi đe preh 'ba păng kơmăi mam

English: But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael, Which shall devour the palaces of Ben-Hadad.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ lăm hnam Hasael, wă soh pơrăm kơđông kơjăp Ben Hadat.

English: I will also break the gate bar of Damascus, And cut off the inhabitant from the Valley of Aven, And the one who holds the scepter from Beth Eden. The people of Syria shall go captive to Kir,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô gơ̆ lê̆ 'long chơkăl 'măng jang pơlei Đamas, Inh gô pơrăm lu kon pơlei oei lăm thŭng Awen păng bơngai mă chĕp 'long jra pơtao sư tơ dêh Bet Eđen; gah kon pơlei Siri gô năm pơm bơnă tơ tơring Kir, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they took captive the whole captivity To deliver them up to Edom.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Gasa rai pơm yoch pơm yoch kơnê̆ hloh kơ adrol, na Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư; yua kơ lu sư rôp ba đĭ-đăng kon pơlei năm pơm bơnă păng jao lu sư kơ bơngai Eđôm

English: But I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza, Which shall devour its palaces.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ kơpal dur pơlei Gasa, ŭnh gô sa pơrăm lu kơđông sư kơjăp.

English: I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod, And the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon; I will turn My hand against Ekron, And the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm kon pơlei oei lăm pơlei Asdôt păng bơngai chĕp 'long jra pơtao sư tơ pơlei Askalon. Inh gô yơ̆r ti Inh blah pơlei Ekrôn; păng lu bơngai Philistin mă oei klaih gô lôch, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Tyre, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom, And did not remember the covenant of brotherhood.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Tirơ pơm yoch rai kơnê̆ hloh kơ adrol, thoi ei na Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư; yua kơ lu sư jao boih đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kơ kon pơlei Eđôm, ưh pă 'blŏk kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p băl tơduă 'nhŏng oh.

English: But I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre, Which shall devour its palaces.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ kơpal dur pơlei Tirơ, sư gô sa pơrăm dôm kơđông kơjăp sư.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Edom, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because he pursued his brother with the sword, And cast off all pity; His anger tore perpetually, And he kept his wrath forever.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Eđôm rai pơm kơnê̆ hloh kơ adrol, thoi ei na Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư. Yua kơ lu sư đei chĕp đao druh 'moi lu 'nhŏng oh sư kơdih, ưh pă đei jơhngơ̆m băt mơnat, tơdrong hil blĕk lu sư kăp hek băl, pă pơdơh mong tơdrong blĕk ling-lang

English: But I will send a fire upon Teman, Which shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ pơlei Têman, sư gô sa pơđĭ lu kơđông kơjăp Bôsra.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of the people of Ammon, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they ripped open the women with child in Gilead, That they might enlarge their territory.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon sâu Ammôn rai pơm yoch hloh kơ adrol ki, thoi ei na Inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư; yua kơ lu sư đei raih boih klak drŏ-kăn oei anăp, lăm char Gileat, wă kơ rĭ hơdral lu sư rai să.

English: But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah, And it shall devour its palaces, Amid shouting in the day of battle, And a tempest in the day of the whirlwind.
Bahnar: Inh gô iŏk ŭnh soh dur pơlei Raba, sư gô sa lê̆ kơđông kơjăp lu sư, đe ôr tơkĕch lăm năr tơblah wang, thoi phŭt huơ̆r lăm năr hơbŭt hơbang.

English: Their king shall go into captivity, He and his princes together,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao păng lu yŏng sư gô pơm bơnă hơdai, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Moab, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because he burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Môap pơm yoch rai hloh kơ adrol, thoi ei na inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư; yua kơ sư đei soh boih kơting pơtao char Eđôm wă pơm chŭr.

English: But I will send a fire upon Moab, And it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth; Moab shall die with tumult, With shouting and trumpet sound.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ dêh Môap, sư gô sa lu kơđông kơjăp Kêriôt. Kon pơlei Môap gô lôch, kơplah đe ôr tơjrông tơjrang păng hlôm keng.

English: And I will cut off the judge from its midst, And slay all its princes with him,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơrăm lê̆ lu 'bok sek tơlang lu sư păng pơlôch đĭ kră yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư hơdai hăm sư, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they have despised the law of the LORD, And have not kept His commandments. Their lies lead them astray, Lies which their fathers followed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Juđa rai pơm yoch hloh kơ adrol, na inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư; Yua kơ lu sư achăng lê̆ boih khôi juăt Kră Yang păng ưh pă pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Sư tơtă, dôm lu yang hơlĕnh pơdăr mă đơ̆ng 'bok yă lu sư kiơ̆, pơm kơ lu sư wơ̆l jrok.

English: But I will send a fire upon Judah, And it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn ŭnh truh tơ dêh Juđa, sư gô sa pơđĭ dôm kơđông kơjăp Jêrusalem.

English: Thus says the LORD: “For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not turn away its punishment, Because they sell the righteous for silver, And the poor for a pair of sandals.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Yua kơ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Isơrael rai pơm yoch hloh kơ adrol, na inh ưh kơ lê̆ ôh wă phak lu sư, yua kơ lu sư tĕch boih lu bơngai tơpăt yua kơ jên păng tĕch lu bơngai dơnuh hin yua kơ hơgrop chơkhŏ chuă.

English: They pant after the dust of the earth which is on the head of the poor, And pervert the way of the humble. A man and his father go in to the same girl, To defile My holy name.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơjuă lê̆ kơ̆l lu bơngai dơnuh hin tơ teh păng pơm kơ trong lu bơngai iơ̆m dim đŏng đĕo. 'Bă kon kư̆m ngôi kư̆ kă hăm minh 'nu drŏ-kăn, thoi noh pơm pơ'mê̆ kơ anăn 'lơ̆ng rơgoh Inh.

English: They lie down by every altar on clothes taken in pledge, And drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bĭch jê̆ tơ chơnang soi, kơpal ao tai đe iŏk boih wă pơm tơmam pơkơ̆ng păng iŏk huch sa sik đêl đe duh tơ hnam yang sư.

English: “Yet it was I who destroyed the Amorite before them, Whose height was like the height of the cedars, And he was as strong as the oaks; Yet I destroyed his fruit above And his roots beneath.
Bahnar: Mă-lei ră, inh pơrăm boih bơngai Amôrit 'bơ̆t anăp lu sư, khŭl bơngai mă tih kơjung dang 'long Sêđar păng pran thoi tơm 'long kôih. Inh pơrăm boih lu plei sư kơpal păng rơh lu sư tơ ala sŭng.

English: Also it was I who brought you up from the land of Egypt, And led you forty years through the wilderness, To possess the land of the Amorite.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m chông iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ păng chông ba lu iĕm kơplah puăn-jĭt sơnăm lăm char glă wă ăn kơ lu iĕm đei teh jang sa đơ̆ng bơngai Amôrit.

English: I raised up some of your sons as prophets, And some of your young men as Nazirites. Is it not so, O you children of Israel?” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh đei pơjing tơiung lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol lăm lu kon pơlei iĕm păng pơjing dôm lu bơngai Nasiril lăm lu kon tơdăm iĕm. Kră Yang khan: Ơ kon sâu Isơrael, hăm trŏ thoi ei?

English: “But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And commanded the prophets saying, ‘Do not prophesy!’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm ăn pơgŏ boih lu bơngai Nasiril huch sik păng khă lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol: Lê̆ pă khan lê̆ adrol!

English: “Behold, I am weighed down by you, As a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
Bahnar: Inh gô kơtĭt lu iĕm kơtă anih lu iĕm kư̆m thoi gre chơ 'ba 'bĕnh kơtĭt juă tơ teh.

English: Therefore flight shall perish from the swift, The strong shall not strengthen his power, Nor shall the mighty deliver himself
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kơdâu kuăng ưh kơ gơh kơdâu klĕnh ôh, lu bơngai pran kơtang kư̆m gô pă kĕ mơ̆n păng lu bơngai nuih kư̆m ưh pă gơh pơklaih akâu sư kơdih.

English: He shall not stand who handles the bow, The swift of foot shall not escape, Nor shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai chĕp hră kư̆m đĭ ưh pă kĕ đơ̆ng; lu bơngai đei jơ̆ng hơbĕch hơbal kư̆m pă gơh weh, lu bơngai hao aseh kư̆m pă gơh pơklaih akâu sư kơdih

English: The most courageous men of might Shall flee naked in that day,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Păng lu bơngai nuih hloh lăm lu bơngai pran kơtang gô kơdâu akâu hoh lăm năr noh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Hear this word that the LORD has spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying
Bahnar: Ơ lu kon sâu Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r âu, 'nâu boih nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang khan wă blah lu iĕm, wă tơblah hăm đĭ-đăng lu adrĕch adrung mă inh đei chông anhăk đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: “You only have I known of all the families of the earth; Therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.”
Bahnar: Lăp minh adrĕch adrung lu iĕm đĕch lăm teh đak âu Inh băt lei na inh gô bơtho pơjĭ yua kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ iĕm pơm.

English: Can two walk together, unless they are agreed?
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bar 'nu ưh kơ lăp đon băl, lei bre sư hăm gơh yak minh pôm trong?

English: Will a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey? Will a young lion cry out of his den, if he has caught nothing?
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ dăm-brang ôr lăm bri, tơdah sư ưh kơ đei rôp sa sem kiơ? Dah dăm-brang ưh kơ đei rôp sa kiơ hăm trŏ sư ôr đơ̆ng lăm trôm anih sư.

English: Will a bird fall into a snare on the earth, where there is no trap for it? Will a snare spring up from the earth, if it has caught nothing at all?
Bahnar: Sem păr tơdah ưh kơ đei hơđong đăk tơ teh wă rôp sư, na sư hăm 'leh ưh? Tơdah hơ'năk ưh kơ đei 'leh kiơ hơnhuăl noh hăm gơh tơgloh đơ̆ng teh ưh?

English: If a trumpet is blown in a city, will not the people be afraid? If there is calamity in a city, will not the LORD have done it?
Bahnar: Dah đe hlôm keng lăm pơlei tih, hăm trŏ lu kon pơlei hli? Tơdah Kră Yang ưh kơ đei pơm lei hăm đei tơdrong truh kơ pơlei noh ưh?

English: Surely the Lord GOD does nothing, Unless He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets.
Bahnar: Kŭm thoi noh Kră Yang ưh kơ đei pơm minh tơdrong kiơ, tơdah sư ưh tam mă tơbăt lê̆ adrol tơdrong hlơp kơ lu đĭch đam sư, lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol.

English: A lion has roared! Who will not fear? The Lord GOD has spoken! Who can but prophesy?
Bahnar: Kơplah dăm-brang ôr grĕnh, hăm đei bu mă ưh kơ hli? Dah Kră Yang bơtho khan boih hăm đei bu ưh kơ khan lê̆ adrol?

English: “Proclaim in the palaces at Ashdod, And in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say: ‘Assemble on the mountains of Samaria; See great tumults in her midst, And the oppressed within her.
Bahnar: Roi tơbăt bĕ tơ lăm lu kơđông kơjăp Asdôt păng tơ lăm lu kơđông kơjăp lăm dêh Êyiptơ: Lu iĕm akŭm băl bĕ tơ kơpal kông lăm char Samari; lăng bĕ đei tơdrong rŭng răng tih tơ noh păng đei tơdrong pơm kơnê̆ băl.

English: For they do not know to do right,’ Says the LORD, ‘Who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.’ ”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Lu sư ưh kơ băt pơm tơdrong tơpăt; lu sư tah mong tơmam tơtông tơgar lăm kơđông kơjăp lu sư.

English: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: “An adversary shall be all around the land; He shall sap your strength from you, And your palaces shall be plundered.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang khan: Lu ayăt gô wang tăp dăr kơ dêh char âu; sư tơpăk lê̆ dur iĕm păng pơrăm tơgar iŏk đĭ dôm lu kơđông kơjăp iĕm.

English: Thus says the LORD: “As a shepherd takes from the mouth of a lion Two legs or a piece of an ear, So shall the children of Israel be taken out Who dwell in Samaria— In the corner of a bed and on the edge of a couch!
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Thoi lu bơngai wei triu dui pơdŭng iŏk 'bar pah jơ̆ng dah minh pah đon đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r dăm-brang, na lu kon sâu Isơrael kư̆m lei-lăi, lu bơngai mă hơ-oei tơ kơpal giơng tơ dêh Samari păng kơpal 'bi lơ̆k tơ pơlei Đamas, kư̆m gô gơh dŏng pơklaih thoi noh.

English: Hear and testify against the house of Jacob,” Says the Lord GOD, the God of hosts
Bahnar: Kră Yang, 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh khan: Mơ̆ng bĕ păng roi tơbăt wă tơblah hăm adrĕch adrung Jakôp.

English: “That in the day I punish Israel for their transgressions, I will also visit destruction on the altars of Bethel; And the horns of the altar shall be cut off And fall to the ground.
Bahnar: Lăm năr mă inh wă phak Isơrael yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư; Inh gô pơrăm lu chơnang soi tơ pơlei Bethel, dôm lu hơke chơnang soi inh gô chơ̆ng tơhuŏng lê̆ tơ teh.

English: I will destroy the winter house along with the summer house; The houses of ivory shall perish, And the great houses shall have an end,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Năr ei kơnh inh gô teh pơrăm hnam bơyan puih păng hnam bơyan phang, lu hnam pơm hăm bơla rôih păng dôm lu hnam tih gô răm đĭ, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Hear this word, you cows of Bashan, who are on the mountain of Samaria, Who oppress the poor, Who crush the needy, Who say to your husbands, “Bring wine, let us drink!”
Bahnar: Mơ̆ng bĕ ơ lu rơmo akăn dêh Basan, oei tơ kông Samari, iĕm pơjuă lu bơngai dơnuh, pơgŏ pơđep lu bơngai hoh kơ đei, khan kơ lu klo iĕm: Chĕp ba sik tơ âu, lu nhôn huch!

English: The Lord GOD has sworn by His holiness: “Behold, the days shall come upon you When He will take you away with fishhooks, And your posterity with fishhooks.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh sư pơkă pơsĭt boih khan: 'Nâu, lu năr wă truh kơ lu iĕm, đe gô wŏk lê̆ lu iĕm, truh tơ kon pơlei iĕm mă oei klaih đe gô wah iŏk.

English: You will go out through broken walls, Each one straight ahead of her, And you will be cast into Harmon,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm gô lĕch trong tơnăr pơchah, rim 'nu lĕch tơpăt anăp kơdih păng đe gô klơ̆m lê̆ lu iĕm tơ Harmôn, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Come to Bethel and transgress, At Gilgal multiply transgression; Bring your sacrifices every morning, Your tithes every three days.
Bahnar: Năm bĕ tơ pơlei Bethel, na pơm yoch; năm bĕ tơ pơlei Gilgal, na pơm yoch rai thim dơ̆ng! Rim pơgê chĕp ba bĕ tơmam soi lu iĕm păng kư̆ kơtĕch pêng năr pơyơ̆r minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng tơmam lu iĕm!

English: Offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, Proclaim and announce the freewill offerings; For this you love, You children of Israel!” Says the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Soh bĕ tơmam soi đei 'buih. Roi tơbăt dôm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r hăm jơhngơ̆m hiôk; roi pơư bĕ wă kơ bơngai lăm teh đak băt; Ơ kon sâu bơngai Isơrael, lu iĕm oei 'maih wă kơ pơm tơdrong noh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Also I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, And lack of bread in all your places; Yet you have not returned to Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Bê̆ gah inh, inh ăn boih pơngot rơwĕt tơ lăm rim pơlei lu iĕm păng pơm ăn tơpŭng sa ưh kơmah, tơ lăm rim anih lu iĕm oei. Mă-lei ră lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ inh! Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I also withheld rain from you, When there were still three months to the harvest. I made it rain on one city, I withheld rain from another city. One part was rained upon, And where it did not rain the part withered.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m ưh kơ ăn đak 'mi jur tơ lu iĕm lăm pêng khei adrol kơ bơyan kĕch yuă inh ăn boih 'mi tơ pơlei tih 'nâu mă-lei ưh kơ ăn 'mi tơ pơlei tih nai. Chŭn âu đei 'mi boih, mă-lei mir to ưh kơ đei 'mi na jô kro đĭ.

English: So two or three cities wandered to another city to drink water, But they were not satisfied; Yet you have not returned to Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, bơngai lăm 'bar pêng tŏ pơlei tih năm tơ minh pôm pơlei chă đak wă nhă, mă-lei nhă ưh kơ hrăp ôh. Mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ inh 'mơ̆i, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I blasted you with blight and mildew. When your gardens increased, Your vineyards, Your fig trees, And your olive trees, The locust devoured them; Yet you have not returned to Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh yua boih kial tŏ păng hơdrông sa 'ba wă bơtho lu iĕm. Đei lơ mir pơgar 'nhot, pơgar hơmu, 'long hơra, 'long ôliwơ lu iĕm đĭ kơ lep sa pơgoh. Mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ Inh 'mơ̆i Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I sent among you a plague after the manner of Egypt; Your young men I killed with a sword, Along with your captive horses; I made the stench of your camps come up into your nostrils; Yet you have not returned to Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh đei ăn boih tơdrong jĭ hơpoh truh tơ lu iĕm, kư̆m thoi inh ăn tơ lăm dêh Êyiptơ. Inh đei yua đao gưm pơlôch lu kon tơdăm iĕm boih păng lu aseh iĕm inh kư̆m puh pơđĭ. Inh đei ăn boih 'bâu ôm đơ̆ng lăm kơđông lu iĕm păr đông tơ muh lu iĕm. Mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ inh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “I overthrew some of you, As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, And you were like a firebrand plucked from the burning; Yet you have not returned to Me,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Inh đei pơrăm boih mơ'nah lăm lu iĕm, thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đei pơrăm pơlei Sôđôm păng Gômôrơ, lu iĕm nhen thoi kơ tôch ŭnh sa đe dui iŏk đơ̆ng ŭnh. Mă-lei lu iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ wă wih brŏk tơ inh, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “Therefore thus will I do to you, O Israel; Because I will do this to you, Prepare to meet your God, O Israel!”
Bahnar: Ơ Isơrael, yua kơ thoi noh na 'nâu inh gô pơm kơ ih; Ơ Isơrael. Yua kơ inh gô pơm kơ ih thoi noh, na ih athei hơmet bĕ wă tơ'bơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih.

English: For behold, He who forms mountains, And creates the wind, Who declares to man what his thought is, And makes the morning darkness, Who treads the high places of the earth— The LORD God of hosts is His name.
Bahnar: Tơpă, sư boih pơjing lu kông păng pơjing kial. Păng roi ăn kơ kon bơngai băt tơdrong sư tơchĕng; sư pơm kơ hơdah jing măng mu păng yak năm lăm anih kơjung hloh kơpal teh. Anăn sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh.

English: Hear this word which I take up against you, a lamentation, O house of Israel
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Isơrael, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r 'nâu, jơ̆ nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ lu iĕm.

English: The virgin of Israel has fallen; She will rise no more. She lies forsaken on her land; There is no one to raise her up.
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai adruh hơlai Isơrael pơ̆k huŏng boih, ưh pă kĕ iung dơ̆ng, sư noh đe klơ̆m lê̆ boih tơ teh, ưh kơ đei bu tơiung sư.

English: For thus says the Lord GOD: “The city that goes out by a thousand Shall have a hundred left, And that which goes out by a hundred Shall have ten left to the house of Israel.”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan: Pơlei ayơ năm minh-rơbâu 'nu linh, oei pă minh-hrĕng 'nu, pơlei ayơ năm minh-hrĕng 'nu, oei pă mơjĭt 'nu lăm adrĕch Isơrael klaih.

English: For thus says the LORD to the house of Israel: “Seek Me and live
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ adrĕch Isơrael: Chă bĕ inh na lu iĕm gô arih.

English: But do not seek Bethel, Nor enter Gilgal, Nor pass over to Beersheba; For Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, And Bethel shall come to nothing.
Bahnar: Lê̆ pă chă pơlei Bethel, 'nĕ pă mơ̆t lăm pơlei Gilgal, dah 'nĕ pă năm rok trong pơlei Bêrsêba. Yua kơ pơlei Gilgal đe gô puh pơm bơnă đĭ, pơlei Bethel gô jing minh anih pơchah pơchek.

English: Seek the LORD and live, Lest He break out like fire in the house of Joseph, And devour it, With no one to quench it in Bethel
Bahnar: Chơchă bĕ Kră Yang, na lu iĕm gô arih; tơdah ưh Kră Yang gô phak adrĕch Jôsep păng pơlei Bethel, thoi ŭnh sa ưh kơ đei bu kĕ pĭt.

English: You who turn justice to wormwood, And lay righteousness to rest in the earth!”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm, tơplih tơdrong tơpăt na iŏk tơm 'long tăng păng klơ̆m lê̆ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt tơ teh.

English: He made the Pleiades and Orion; He turns the shadow of death into morning And makes the day dark as night; He calls for the waters of the sea And pours them out on the face of the earth; The LORD is His name.
Bahnar: Chơchă bĕ Tơ'ngla pơjing kơ sơnglŏng hơdrŭng iĕr păng sơnglŏng gŭt-'năk, na tơplih măng mu jing hơdah, 'năr jing măng, Tơ'ngla krao đak đơ̆ng lăm dơsĭ na tuh kơpal teh. Anăn Sư Kră Yang.

English: He rains ruin upon the strong, So that fury comes upon the fortress.
Bahnar: Noh boih Kră Yang Tơ'ngla mă pơm kơ lu bơngai pran kơtang 'bôh 'băi lôch răm hloi, tơdrong pơrăm dĭng mah truh tơ lăm kơđông.

English: They hate the one who rebukes in the gate, And they abhor the one who speaks uprightly.
Bahnar: Lu sư areh kơ lu bơngai ngăl chrih kơ lu sư tơ 'măng jang pơlei păng ưh kơ iă kơ lu bơngai pơma tơpăt.

English: Therefore, because you tread down the poor And take grain taxes from him, Though you have built houses of hewn stone, Yet you shall not dwell in them; You have planted pleasant vineyards, But you shall not drink wine from them.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lu iĕm pơjuă lu bơngai dơnuh răm păng pơgŏ lu sư rai ăn 'ba mi, mă khan lu iĕm đei pơm boih lu hnam man păng tơmo iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ gơh oei ôh. Lu iĕm đei pơtăm boih pơgar hơmu đei plei 'ngam mă-lei kư̆m ưh kơ đei huch đak sik sư ôh.

English: For I know your manifold transgressions And your mighty sins: Afflicting the just and taking bribes; Diverting the poor from justice at the gate.
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh băt boih kơ tơdrong yoch lu iĕm lơ pă băt dang yơ, tơdrong yoch iĕm tih dêh, lu iĕm pơmat lu bơngai tơpăt, iŏk sa pơgâm, tơ anih 'măng jang pơlei lu iĕm sơngah kơ tơdrong trŏ tơpăt lu bơngai dơnuh hin lăm năr sek tơlang.

English: Therefore the prudent keep silent at that time, For it is an evil time.
Bahnar: Yua kơ lăm chăl kơnê̆ dêh yua kơ thoi noh lu bơngai hơgei gô mơ̆ng đĕch; lăm chăl thoi âu.

English: Seek good and not evil, That you may live; So the LORD God of hosts will be with you, As you have spoken.
Bahnar: Chơchă bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng păng 'nĕ pă chă tơdrong kơnê̆, wă kơ lu iĕm đei tơdrong arih, na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh gô oei hơdai iĕm, thoi iĕm đei hơpơi boih.

English: Hate evil, love good; Establish justice in the gate. It may be that the LORD God of hosts Will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
Bahnar: Areh bĕ kơ tơdrong kơnê̆, na 'mêm bĕ kơ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng; pơm pơjing bĕ tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei. Rŏ lăng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh gô mơnat ăn kơ dôm lu bơngai Jôsep mă oei arih.

English: Therefore the LORD God of hosts, the Lord, says this: “There shall be wailing in all streets, And they shall say in all the highways, ‘Alas! Alas!’ They shall call the farmer to mourning, And skillful lamenters to wailing.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh, khan thoi âu: Tơ rim anih lăm pơlei đe gô nhơ̆m hmoi: Tơ rim trong đe ôr krao ơu pơmat dêh! Ơu pơmat dêh! Đe gô pơtơm lu bơngai choh mir chŭn năm truh tơ anih ơh sơ'ngon păng chă lu bơngai gơh hmoi năm nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: In all vineyards there shall be wailing, For I will pass through you,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Tơ lăm pơgar hơmu gô kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ inh gô yak tŏk-bŏk iĕm, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: Woe to you who desire the day of the LORD! For what good is the day of the LORD to you? It will be darkness, and not light.
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu iĕm mă chang gô năr Kră Yang! Lu iĕm chang gô năr Kră Yang wă pơm kiơ? Noh năr măng mu, ưh kơ trŏ năr hơdah ôh.

English: It will be as though a man fled from a lion, And a bear met him! Or as though he went into the house, Leaned his hand on the wall, And a serpent bit him!
Bahnar: Thoi minh 'nu bơngai kơdâu đơ̆ng dăm-brang mă-lei oei tơ'bơ̆p chơgơu dơ̆ng; dah thoi lu đe mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam, hơgơn ti tơ tơnăr, na 'bih choh ti sư.

English: Is not the day of the LORD darkness, and not light? Is it not very dark, with no brightness in it?
Bahnar: Năr Kră Yang hăm trŏ măng mu, ưh kơ hơdah, noh tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon, măng klăm hăm đei hơdah hơdong rang mơnhal deh?

English: “I hate, I despise your feast days, And I do not savor your sacred assemblies.
Bahnar: Inh areh, inh sơ'ngon kơ năr iĕm pơm kơ̆m giĕng; Inh ưh kơ hiôk gah tơdrong iĕm akŭm kơkuh tih noh.

English: Though you offer Me burnt offerings and your grain offerings, I will not accept them, Nor will I regard your fattened peace offerings.
Bahnar: Mă khan iĕm pơyơ̆r kơ inh dôm tơmam soi phe 'ba, dah tơmam soi 'buh, inh ưh kơ iŏk ôh; Inh ưh kơ wă lăng ôh dôm lu tơmam soi bơnê hăm rơmo bek đơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: Take away from Me the noise of your songs, For I will not hear the melody of your stringed instruments.
Bahnar: Weh ataih bĕ dôm nơ̆r hơri lu iĕm đơ̆ng inh! Inh ưh kơ 'maih mơ̆ng nơ̆r brŏ-kơni đơ̆ng lu iĕm.

English: But let justice run down like water, And righteousness like a mighty stream.
Bahnar: Kơtrơ̆m jah lê̆ lu tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt sĭt ro thoi đak păng tơdrong tơpăt kơkhŭr thoi đak glung ro ling-lang.

English: “Did you offer Me sacrifices and offerings In the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
Bahnar: Ơ adrĕch Isơrael lu iĕm hăm lah pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ inh kơplah lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm tơ char glă sơ̆ ưh?

English: You also carried Sikkuth your king And Chiun, your idols, The star of your gods, Which you made for yourselves.
Bahnar: Tă tơ, lu iĕm tung hnam bơsŭn pơtao iĕm, bơwei rup yang iĕm man păng yang sơnglŏng mă lu iĕm đei man kơdih.

English: Therefore I will send you into captivity beyond Damascus,” Says the LORD, whose name is the God of hosts.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, gô rôp ba lu iĕm jing pơm đĭch tơ pah to pơlei Đamas, Kră Yang khan thoi noh, anăn sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh.

English: Woe to you who are at ease in Zion, And trust in Mount Samaria, Notable persons in the chief nation, To whom the house of Israel comes!
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu đe bu mă oei arih sa đei đe ư-ang lăm pơlei Siôn păng lu bơngai khan kơ sư oei hiôk-hian tơ kông Samari! Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu đe bu mă yŏng mơng chĕp kơ̆l lăm teh đak, mă mônh noh jơ̆ lu adrĕch Isơrael ning-mônh!

English: Go over to Calneh and see; And from there go to Hamath the great; Then go down to Gath of the Philistines. Are you better than these kingdoms? Or is their territory greater than your territory?
Bahnar: Năm bĕ tơ pơlei Kalneh păng lăng, yak năm bĕ đơ̆ng noh truh tơ pơlei tih Hamat, jur hloi tơ pơlei Gat lu bơngai Philistin. Lu pơlei noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ dêh âu hă? Hăm trŏ kơ dêh noh să hloh kơ dêh iĕm?

English: Woe to you who put far off the day of doom, Who cause the seat of violence to come near
Bahnar: Lu iĕm pơm kơ năr pơmat khan roi ataih, mă-lei pơm ăn kơ tơdrong kơnê̆ rai jê̆ truh!

English: Who lie on beds of ivory, Stretch out on your couches, Eat lambs from the flock And calves from the midst of the stall
Bahnar: Răm-'băm dêh kơ lu bơngai tep tơ giơng bơla păng yon pơdăng jơ̆ng kơpal tang-dŏ iĕm; 'buh sa lu kon triu mă rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm khŭl păng 'bet sa rơmo bek đơ̆ng lăm hơdrong.

English: Who sing idly to the sound of stringed instruments, And invent for yourselves musical instruments like David
Bahnar: Tơpă, lu iĕm hơri nơ̆r kư̆ kă chă pơlăp kiơ̆ kơ brŏ chă pơm brŏ kơdih khan rok thoi pơtao Đawit.

English: Who drink wine from bowls, And anoint yourselves with the best ointments, But are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
Bahnar: Lu iĕm huch sik hăm pơnhan mŏng tih, yua pơgang 'bâu phu kăp jên pik tơ akâu wă kơ 'bâu phu kơdih akâu, ưh pă 'blŏk boih tơdrong truh kơ adrĕch Jôsep!

English: Therefore they shall now go captive as the first of the captives, And those who recline at banquets shall be removed.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh đe gô rôp lu iĕm pơm bơnă adrol hloh kơ lu bơngai mă đe đei rôp, lei na wă kơ ưh pă kơtơ̆ng boih nơ̆r ôr chơt hiôk lu bơngai noh!

English: The Lord GOD has sworn by Himself, The LORD God of hosts says: “I abhor the pride of Jacob, And hate his palaces; Therefore I will deliver up the city And all that is in it.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Tih hloh khan thoi âu: Kră Yang pao anăn Sư kơdih păng pơkă khan: Inh areh dêh kơ tơdrong pơang Jakôp păng hil mĭl kơ kơđông kơjăp sư; yua kơ thoi noh inh gô jao pơlei tih âu păng dôm lu tơmam lăm noh kơ lu ayăt.

English: Then it shall come to pass, that if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.
Bahnar: Tơdah lăm hnam oei đei pă mơjĭt 'nu, lu sư kư̆m gô lôch pơđĭ.

English: And when a relative of the dead, with one who will burn the bodies, picks up the bodies to take them out of the house, he will say to one inside the house, “Are there any more with you?” Then someone will say, “None.” And he will say, “Hold your tongue! For we dare not mention the name of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu lăm adrĕch adrung jê̆ athei soh akâu lôch noh iŏk ba bĕ kơting sư đơ̆ng lăm hnam; tơ 'nguaih bơngai noh gô apinh bơngai oei lăm hnam: Hăm pă đei bu oei hơdai ih? Sư gô tơl: Ưh pă đei bu boih! Na bơngai kơtum noh khan: 'Nĕ pă pơma 'bơm anăn Kră Yang!

English: For behold, the LORD gives a command: He will break the great house into bits, And the little house into pieces.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang khan boih, lu hnam tih gô păk hơlŭng răm đĭ, hnam iĕ gô pơchah reng 'beng.

English: Do horses run on rocks? Does one plow there with oxen? Yet you have turned justice into gall, And the fruit of righteousness into wormwood
Bahnar: Iĕm hăm lah ăn kơ aseh kơdâu kơpal tơmo tih? Đe hăm choh rơmo tơ kơpal tơmo? Mă-lei lu iĕm tơplih tơdrong tơpăt jing tơdrong chhŭr nuih păng tơplih plei 'lơ̆ng tơpăt jing plei tăng.

English: You who rejoice over Lo Debar, Who say, “Have we not taken Karnaim for ourselves By our own strength?”
Bahnar: Lu iĕm bơngai mă chơt hiôk đei blah iŏk pơlei Lôdêbar,a păng khan: Lu nhôn yua jơhngơ̆m pran kơdih na đei iŏk boih pơlei Kanaim;b

English: “But, behold, I will raise up a nation against you, O house of Israel,” Says the LORD God of hosts; “And they will afflict you from the entrance of Hamath To the Valley of the Arabah.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Ơ hnam Isơrael Inh đei ăn boih minh adrĕch adrung iung blah iĕm, lu sư gô teh pơjuă lu iĕm, iŏk đơ̆ng trong mơ̆t lăm tơring Hamat dĭng truh tơ thong đak Araba

English: Thus the Lord GOD showed me: Behold, He formed locust swarms at the beginning of the late crop; indeed it was the late crop after the king’s mowings.
Bahnar: 'Nâu mă tơdrong Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh: Sư pơjing lu lep lăm kơplah 'nhĕt 'nao wă bluh dơ̆ng. Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe yuă ăn kơ pơtao.

English: And so it was, when they had finished eating the grass of the land, that I said: “O Lord GOD, forgive, I pray! Oh, that Jacob may stand, For he is small!”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ lep sa đĭ 'nhĕt lăm teh boih, inh khan: Ơ Kră Yang, inh apinh Ih mơnat ăn! Liơ Jakôp gơh kĕ arih? Yua kơ sư tŏ sĕt păng tơrăn dêh.

English: So the LORD relented concerning this. “It shall not be,” said the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơplih đon tơchĕng. Kră Yang khan thoi âu: Tơdrong noh huay pă đei truh dơ̆ng.

English: Thus the Lord GOD showed me: Behold, the Lord GOD called for conflict by fire, and it consumed the great deep and devoured the territory.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh: Kră Yang ăn ŭnh truh wă sek tơlang ŭnh noh sa jrŭ să, oei sa sơlŭng păng teh đak.

English: Then I said: “O Lord GOD, cease, I pray! Oh, that Jacob may stand, For he is small!”
Bahnar: Na inh khan: Ơ Kră Yang, inh apinh Ih pơdơh bĕ, liơ Jakôp oei kĕ dơ̆ng, yua kơ tŏ sĕt păng tơrăn dêh. Kră Yang tơplih đon.

English: So the LORD relented concerning this. “This also shall not be,” said the Lord GOD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Tơdrong noh huay pă truh dơ̆ng.

English: Thus He showed me: Behold, the Lord stood on a wall made with a plumb line, with a plumb line in His hand.
Bahnar: Sư tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh: 'Nâu Kră Yang dơ̆ng kơpal dur mă đei man tơpăt păng ti Sư chĕp minh dăng tơlei wă kơ pơtŏ.

English: And the LORD said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” And I said, “A plumb line.” Then the Lord said: “Behold, I am setting a plumb line In the midst of My people Israel; I will not pass by them anymore.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ inh dơ̆ng: Ơ Amôs ih 'bôh kiơ? Inh khan: Minh dăng tơlei pơtŏ, na Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu Inh gô dăng tơlei pơtŏ hơgăt lăm kon pơlei Isơrael Inh. Inh ưh pă 'mêm kơ sư dơ̆ng.

English: The high places of Isaac shall be desolate, And the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste. I will rise with the sword against the house of Jeroboam.”
Bahnar: Lu anih kơjung Isăk gô juơ, lu anih rơgoh Isơrael gô pơrăm đĭ păng inh gô iŏk đao gưm iung blah hnam Jêrôbôam. Amôt păng 'bok soi Amsia

English: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Amsia, 'bok soi pơlei Bethel, wơh đe năm pơtruh nơ̆r kơ Jêrôbôam pơtao Isơrael khan: Amôs sư pơdôr kon pơlei Isơrael wă blah pơm kơnê̆ kơ ih teh đak bơ̆n gô hiong răm yua kơ đơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r sư.

English: For thus Amos has said: ‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword, And Israel shall surely be led away captive From their own land.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ Amôs đei khan boih Jêrôbôam gô lôch kơ đao gưm păng Isơrael sĭt tơpă gô pơm bơnă đe gô puh tơweh đơ̆ng teh đak lu sư kơdih!

English: Then Amaziah said to Amos: “Go, you seer! Flee to the land of Judah. There eat bread, And there prophesy.
Bahnar: Amsia khan kơ Amôs: Ơ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, weh bĕ đơ̆ng âu, năm tơ lăm teh đak Juđa, arih sa păng khan lê̆ adrol tơ noh.

English: But never again prophesy at Bethel, For it is the king’s sanctuary, And it is the royal residence.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'nĕ pă khan lê̆ adrol tơ pơlei Bethel âu, yua kơ noh anih rơgoh pơtao păng noh anih hnam pơtao akŭm kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then Amos answered, and said to Amaziah: “I was no prophet, Nor was I a son of a prophet, But I was a sheepbreeder And a tender of sycamore fruit.
Bahnar: Amôs tơl Amsia: Inh ưh kơ trŏ bơngai khan lê̆ adrol ôh păng inh kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon 'bok khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆n; mă-lei inh jing minh 'nu bơngai wei triu păng bơngai bơwei hơmet dôm lu 'long hơra bri brah đĕch.

English: Then the LORD took me as I followed the flock, And the LORD said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to My people Israel.’
Bahnar: Kră Yang iŏk inh đơ̆ng anih wei triu păng khan kơ inh: Ih năm khan lê̆ adrol bĕ kơ kon pơlei Isơrael inh.

English: Now therefore, hear the word of the LORD: You say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel, And do not spout against the house of Isaac.’
Bahnar: Na mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang: Ih khan thoi âu: 'Nĕ khan lê̆ adrol wă blah Isơrael păng kư̆m 'nĕ kơ bơtho đe pơm kơnê̆ hăm Isăk.

English: “Therefore thus says the LORD: ‘Your wife shall be a harlot in the city; Your sons and daughters shall fall by the sword; Your land shall be divided by survey line; You shall die in a defiled land; And Israel shall surely be led away captive From his own land.’ ”
Bahnar: Yua kơ inh khan thoi noh na Kră Yang khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: Akăn ih gô pơm đi tơ lăm pơlei tih; kon drŏ-nglo păng kon drŏ-kăn ih gô lôch kơ đao gưm, teh đak ih gô klah asong pơtŏ păng tơlei, gah ih, ih gô lôch lăm teh đak 'mê̆-'mach păng Isơrael gô pơm đĭch tơ dêh đe.

English: Thus the Lord GOD showed me: Behold, a basket of summer fruit.
Bahnar: 'Nâu tơdrong mă Kră Yang tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh. 'Nâu đei minh pôm bai plei 'long bơyan puih.

English: And He said, “Amos, what do you see?” So I said, “A basket of summer fruit.” Then the LORD said to me: “The end has come upon My people Israel; I will not pass by them anymore.
Bahnar: Sư khan: Amôs, ih 'bôh kiơ? Inh tơl: Inh 'bôh minh pôm bai plei 'long bơyan puih, Kră Yang khan kơ inh dơ̆ng thoi âu: Năr tôch truh boih tơ kon pơlei Isơrael; Inh ưh pă 'mêm kơ sư dơ̆ng.

English: And the songs of the temple Shall be wailing in that day,” Says the Lord GOD— “Many dead bodies everywhere, They shall be thrown out in silence.”
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, dôm lu tơdrong hơri lăm hnam pơtao gô jing nơ̆r nhơ̆m hmoi Kră Yang khan. Gô đei lơ akâu bơngai lôch đe gô klơ̆m hŭt lê̆ tơ jơ̆p anih hreh tơthĕng.

English: Hear this, you who swallow up the needy, And make the poor of the land fail
Bahnar: Iĕm mă lu bơngai luăn sa pơjuă bơhlơ̆r lu bơngai dơnuh hin păng pơrăm lu bơngai pơmat-tat kơpal teh, mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r 'nâu.

English: Saying: “When will the New Moon be past, That we may sell grain? And the Sabbath, That we may trade wheat? Making the ephah small and the shekel large, Falsifying the scales by deceit
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: Layơ khei 'nao jah đĭ wă kơ bơ̆n gơh tĕch 'ba layơ năr Sa'bat, tôch wă kơ lu bơ̆n gô pơih pơk 'ba mi, na bơ̆n tĕch pơhrŏ lê̆ epha na pơthim kơ jên hu rai trăp păng bơ̆n kŏng hơlĕnh wă hơlĕnh kơ đe.

English: That we may buy the poor for silver, And the needy for a pair of sandals— Even sell the bad wheat?”
Bahnar: Wă kơ lu bơ̆n iŏk jên noh na răt iŏk lu bơngai mă pơmat-tat, iŏk minh hơgrop chơkhŏ tơplih bơngai dơnuh hin păng tĕch pơđĭ truh tơ lu 'ba mi bo.

English: The LORD has sworn by the pride of Jacob: “Surely I will never forget any of their works.
Bahnar: Kră Yang pao anăn sư mă Jakôp ư-ang, na pơkăm pơkă nơ̆r 'nâu: Sĭt inh ưh kơ đei layơ hiơt dôm tơdrong mă lu sư đei pơm!

English: Shall the land not tremble for this, And everyone mourn who dwells in it? All of it shall swell like the River, Heave and subside Like the River of Egypt.
Bahnar: Teh đak ưh kơ tơdrŏ hă kơ tơdrong noh, đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei sư ưh kơ nhơ̆m hmoi hă? Đĭ-đăng teh tŏk 'bĕnh blai nhen thoi đak krong Nil sư gô pơpơ̆ păng hrŏ thoi đak krong Êyiptơ noh.

English: “And it shall come to pass in that day,” says the Lord GOD, “That I will make the sun go down at noon, And I will darken the earth in broad daylight
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Lăm năr noh gô đei tơdrong truh, inh gô pơm ăn kơ măt 'năr mơ̆t kơplah măt 'năr dơ̆ng păng pơm kơ teh măng mu kơplah 'năr oei đei.

English: I will turn your feasts into mourning, And all your songs into lamentation; I will bring sackcloth on every waist, And baldness on every head; I will make it like mourning for an only son, And its end like a bitter day.
Bahnar: Inh gô ăn kơ năr chơt hiôk iĕm jing năr ơh sơ'ngon păng đĭ-đăng lu tơdrong hơri iĕm jing nhơ̆m hmoi. Inh gô chô̆ ăn 'bi nai tơ rim kơiĕng păng pơm ăn kơ rim kơ̆l jing kơ̆l hoh. Inh gô ăn tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon, thoi hiong minh 'nu kon pôm drŏ-nglo păng năr tôch sư thoi năr ơh sơ'ngon dêh.

English: “Behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord GOD, “That I will send a famine on the land, Not a famine of bread, Nor a thirst for water, But of hearing the words of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: 'Nâu 'năr wă truh noh kơplah inh ăn tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt truh tơ lăm teh đak, ưh kơ trŏ khan pơngot kơ por sŏng, kư̆m ưh kơ trŏ rơhing kơ đak, mă-lei pơngot kơ 'maih wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: They shall wander from sea to sea, And from north to east; They shall run to and fro, seeking the word of the LORD, But shall not find it.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô năm pơtoi đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ âu dĭng truh tơ đak dơsĭ to, đơ̆ng yă-nơ̆m truh tơ gah hơlĕch; kơdâu tơ âu tơ to wă chă nơ̆r Kră Yang, mă-lei chă ưh kơ đei.

English: “In that day the fair virgins And strong young men Shall faint from thirst.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, lu adruh hơlai 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ păng lu tơdăm gô rơdu rơmơ̆n, yua kơ rơhing.

English: Those who swear by the sin of Samaria, Who say, ‘As your god lives, O Dan!’ And, ‘As the way of Beersheba lives!’ They shall fall and never rise again.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai tơhlâu kơ Asima char Samari păng pơkă pơkăm: Ơ Đan, thoi yang ih oei arih! Thoi yang pơlei Bêrsêba oei arih! Đĭ-đăng lu bơngai kơkuh kơ yang gô pơ̆k păng ưh pă kĕ iung dơ̆ng.

English: I saw the Lord standing by the altar, and He said: “Strike the doorposts, that the thresholds may shake, And break them on the heads of them all. I will slay the last of them with the sword. He who flees from them shall not get away, And he who escapes from them shall not be delivered.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh Kră Yang dơ̆ng jê̆ chơnang soi păng khan thoi âu: Teh pơchah lê̆ bĕ lu jrăng tơm, wă kơ lu 'măng pơpơ̆, teh pơhĕch tơ kơpal kơ̆l lu kon pơlei! Lu đe bu mă oei arih lăm lu sư inh gô pơlôch păng đao gưm, ưh kơ đei bu gơh klĕnh, ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bu gơh kơdâu klĕnh klaih hlôi.

English: “Though they dig into hell, From there My hand shall take them; Though they climb up to heaven, From there I will bring them down
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư sir jrŭ truh tơ dêh hơtâu, ti inh kư̆m gô wŏk iŏk lu sư lĕch; mă khan lu sư tŏk truh tơ plĕnh, inh gô tơjur tơhuŏng lê̆ lu sư đơ̆ng noh.

English: And though they hide themselves on top of Carmel, From there I will search and take them; Though they hide from My sight at the bottom of the sea, From there I will command the serpent, and it shall bite them
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư kơdâu ôn tơ kơpal kông Karmel, inh kư̆m gô chă wă pơdŭng tơlĕch lu sư; mă khan lu sư klĕnh đơ̆ng muh măt inh ôn tơ ala đak dơsĭ sŭng, inh kư̆m gô ăn kơ 'bih choh lu sư tơ noh.

English: Though they go into captivity before their enemies, From there I will command the sword, And it shall slay them. I will set My eyes on them for harm and not for good.”
Bahnar: Mă khan lu sư năm pơm bơnă 'bơ̆t anăp lu ayăt kơ lu sư, tơ noh inh kư̆m gô ăn đao gưm năm pơlôch lu sư. Inh gô răp lăng tơ lu sư wă pơrăm, ưh kơ trŏ wă ăn tơdrong hiôk ôh.

English: The Lord GOD of hosts, He who touches the earth and it melts, And all who dwell there mourn; All of it shall swell like the River, And subside like the River of Egypt.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, sư pel 'bơm teh, teh lek đĭ, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei oei lăm noh gô nhơ̆m hmoi jơ̆p kơ teh đak tŏk blai thoi đak krong Nil păng sư gô hrơ̆ thoi đak krong dêh Êyiptơ.

English: He who builds His layers in the sky, And has founded His strata in the earth; Who calls for the waters of the sea, And pours them out on the face of the earth— The LORD is His name.
Bahnar: Kră Yang đei pơjing hnam sư lăm lu tăl plĕnh, đei pơm boih plĕnh krôp kơpal teh. Sư krao đak đơ̆ng dơsĭ păng tuh jơ̆p kơpal teh. Anăn Sư Kră Yang.

English: “Are you not like the people of Ethiopia to Me, O children of Israel?” says the LORD. “Did I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt, The Philistines from Caphtor, And the Syrians from Kir?
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Ơ kon sâu Isơrael, hăm trŏ Inh ưh kơ lăng iĕm thoi lu kon sâu bơngai Êthiôpi? Inh ưh kơ trŏ chông tơlĕch iĕm đơ̆ng teh đak Êyiptơ, bơngai Philistin đơ̆ng Kaptôr păng bơngai Siri đơ̆ng char Kir hă?

English: “Behold, the eyes of the Lord GOD are on the sinful kingdom, And I will destroy it from the face of the earth; Yet I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,” Says the LORD.
Bahnar: Sĭt măt Kră Yang oei răp lăng kơpal teh đak yoch âu păng inh gô pơrăm sư đơ̆ng kơpal teh âu, mă-lei inh ưh kơ pơlôch đĭ hnam Jakôp, Kră Yang khan thoi noh.

English: “For surely I will command, And will sift the house of Israel among all nations, As grain is sifted in a sieve; Yet not the smallest grain shall fall to the ground.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh, inh gô tơtă athei păng gô săi adrĕch Isơrael tơ rim adrĕch drung thoi đe um 'ba hăm kơđum, mă-lei ưh kơ đei minh găr iĕ ayơ huŏng tơ teh.

English: All the sinners of My people shall die by the sword, Who say, ‘The calamity shall not overtake nor confront us.’
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng dôm lu bơngai yoch lăm kon pơlei inh, lu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm lu sư khan: Tơdrong kơnê̆ ưh pă jê̆ lu bơ̆n păng ưh pă tam truh tơ lu bơ̆n, na lu sư gô lôch kơ đao gưm.

English: “On that day I will raise up The tabernacle of David, which has fallen down, And repair its damages; I will raise up its ruins, And rebuild it as in the days of old
Bahnar: “Lăm năr noh, inh gô tơiung pơdơ̆ng bơsŭn Đawit, mă đêl păk boih păng hơmet ming lu bơlôh hiah sư. Inh gô pơdơ̆ng ming lu đêl pơchah păng man ming thoi sơ̆

English: That they may possess the remnant of Edom, And all the Gentiles who are called by My name,” Says the LORD who does this thing.
Bahnar: Ăn kơ kon pơlei Inh blah iŏk lu kon pơlei Eđôm mă oei oei. Păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei jơ̆p kơ dêh char gô ư-ang anăn Inh”

English: “Behold, the days are coming,” says the LORD, “When the plowman shall overtake the reaper, And the treader of grapes him who sows seed; The mountains shall drip with sweet wine, And all the hills shall flow with it.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan: Năr gô truh tơ anăp kơnh lu bơngai choh rơmo gô tam lu bơngai lu bơngai yuă, lu bơngai pơjuă plei hơmu gô kiơ̆ tam lu bơngai rei adrĕch. Lu kông gô lĕch sik hơmu 'ngam păng sik hơmu gô ro đơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang lu groi kông.

English: I will bring back the captives of My people Israel; They shall build the waste cities and inhabit them; They shall plant vineyards and drink wine from them; They shall also make gardens and eat fruit from them.
Bahnar: Inh gô chông lu bơngai Isơrael brŏk đơ̆ng pơm bơnă, lu sư gô pơjing pơdơ̆ng dơ̆ng lu pơlei tih mă đêl đe pơrăm păng oei hloi tơ noh. Lu sư gô choh pơtăm mir hơmu păng huch đak sư, gô choh pơtăm war mir pơgar hla 'nhot, plei 'long păng gô sa plei sư.

English: I will plant them in their land, And no longer shall they be pulled up From the land I have given them,” Says the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Inh gô pơtăm lu sư tơ teh đak lu sư kơdih păng ưh pă đei bu buch lu sư dơ̆ng đơ̆ng teh mă inh đei ăn boih kơ lu sư Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih khan thoi noh.
